lines.text: My study of the mind has convinced me how little we know of its powers.

[discussing the murders]
It all seemed to start with that skeleton of Agor Singh's.
You know, that's good enough for me. I'm gonna arrest that Hindu if I never see the back of my neck.
A little knowledge of the occult is dangerous. Unless it's used for good, disaster will follow its wake. That is Cosmic Law!
How many of us are sane? You wouldn't know, but I shall soon.

[reacting to Laurie's stopping the car by the side of a deserted road]
What's this for - as if I didn't know?
How is it dames always know what's on a guy's mind before he knows himself?
When a person questions her own sanity, it's a good sign she's not far from normal.
How is that the blood didn't dematerialize with the rest?
There are certain details in the process that we are not allowed to explain to the uninitiated.
Blood... the whole house reeks of it. The air is charged with death and hatred and something that's unclean!
I see it but I still don't believe it.

[trapped in burning room]
Unlock that door you fool! Do you want to die?
Yes! You and Kurt don't deserve to live, and I don't want to!
